messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Virus alert
messages.msgSnippet: ... It might be caused by an ISP that has a limit to mail size. I remember it happening occasionally on AOL. Joyce
messages.messageBody:
on 12/19/02 1:04 PM, starsuncloud@... at starsuncloud@... wrote:

> Once in a while, I get a digest that is in attachment form. I always just
> delete it and try to read the messages right at the list site. Any ideas why
> this happens? Is it just a Yahoo quirk?

It might be caused by an ISP that has a limit to mail size. I remember it
happening occasionally on AOL.

Joyce

messages.subject: Virus alert
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 12/19/02 11:03:34 AM Central Standard Time, Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 12/19/02 11:03:34 AM Central Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

<< Just to reassure people, the list is set to strip off attachments so there
won't be any viruses spread through this list. >>

Once in a while, I get a digest that is in attachment form. I always just
delete it and try to read the messages right at the list site. Any ideas why
this happens? Is it just a Yahoo quirk?

Ren
"Knowledge will not always take the place of simple observation."
~Arnold Lobel
Unschooling support at pensacolaunschoolers.com
